Key Match Events: The Pirates entered the 7th inning of their game against the Cubs trailing 10-3 and the prospects for a comeback did not look very good. Then Pittsburgh’s bullpen, which has been a major liability for them all season, had a total meltdown and Chicago scored 11 times to pull off a shocking victory and complete a sweep.
Christian Bethancourt cut the margin to 10-5 when he blasted a two-run homer against Kyle Nicolas in the 7th.
Dansby Swanson hit into a force out to cut the deficit to 10-9
Christian Bethancourt lined a go-ahead two-run single past third base to give the North Siders an 11-10 advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: That was quite a comeback for the Cubs, who desperately needed it to stay in the race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates had the bases loaded twice in the late innings and were not able to add any insurance.
Others: The Cubs scored a whopping 41 runs over the three games of this sweep.
Some of that was due to a truly awful Pirates relief unit, but maybe it’s something they can build on going forward.
